Request for investigation and prosecution of the HONG KONG POLICE FORCE

Dear Sirs,

I would like to report that during the past few months, there were frequent demonstrations in Hong Kong by the local citizens, which were initiated to object the Extradition Bill proposed by the Hong Kong Government.

During the demonstrations, the Hong Kong Police used unreasonable brutal forces / violence to disperse and arrest the demonstrators, including physical attacks, tear gas and plastic bullets.

As identified and verified by the demonstrators, tear gas used by the Hong Kong Police were well past the Expiry date and we understand that expired tear gas is actually toxic or harmful to health.

The Hong Kong SAR government refused and keep on refusing to form an independent investigation committee to investigate the current turmoil as well as the seemingly unlawful acts done by the police police force.

In this regard, I would like to seek your assistance to instigate investigation into the unlawful enforcement of the Hong Kong Police, including the use of expired tear gas.

Thank you for your kind attention. I hope by your international impartial status as well as the connection with the UN, you can help us to stop the violence and offences being done by the HK Police, and bring true justice to us.

Regards,

XXXX
A Hong Kong citizen

Request for investigation and prosecution of the HONG KONG POLICE FORCE

Dear Sir/ Madam,

Over the past months in Hong Kong, dozens of demonstrations were held in protest of the amendments proposed to the Fugitive Offenders Ordinance, also known as the Extradition bill, by the government.
However, the government has refused to back down, directing the Hong Kong Police Force (HKPF) to employ increasingly brutal and excessive violence to disperse and arrest not only protesters, but also innocent bystanders.
As witnessed by multiple media outlets around the globe, the HKPF has chosen to deploy its use of “less-lethal” weaponry in manners clearly violating guidelines, aiming their gas canisters and sponge bullets directly towards the heads of reporters, protesters and bystanders alike – leading to multiple injuries, including partial and total loss of vision in some cases.
Moreover, as identified and verified by multiple outlets, the tear gas used by the HKPF was also well past its use by date, and may cause serious, or even lethal damage to the inhalants’ health, as the chemicals used may degrade into phosgene and cyanide. The HKPF has refused to answer to multiple enquiries by the press on this matter, and has even resorted to removing the expiry date on the gas canisters fired.
Meanwhile, despite pleads from different parties across the societal spectrum, the Hong Kong SAR government has refused to form an independent investigation committee regarding the current political turmoil, and the suspected wrongdoings of its force.
In light of such events, I humbly plead for your assistance, to launch an investigation on the unlawful and extreme violence demonstrated by the HKPF, and to, by whatever means necessary, condemn the wrongdoings of the HKPF, should any be found.
Thank you for your kind attention. I sincerely wish that, your renowned and impartial status, along with connections to the UN, may bring much needed attention, and stop future misdeeds from the HKPF.

Regards,
XXXX
A desperate Hong Kong citizen

Dear Sir/ Madam,
I would like to report that during the past few months, there were frequent demonstrations in Hong Kong by the local citizens, which were initiated to object the Extradition Bill proposed by the Hong Kong Government.

During the demonstrations, the Hong Kong Police used unreasonable brutal forces / violence to disperse and arrest the demonstrators, including physical attacks, tear gas and plastic bullets.

As identified and verified by the demonstrators, tear gas used by the Hong Kong Police were well past the Expiry date and we understand that expired tear gas is actually toxic or harmful to health.

Meanwhile, on 11-Aug-2019, the Hong Kong Police Force shoot Tear Gas into underground metro-stations while the demonstrators are leaving. We understand that using tear gas in in-door area where air circulation is bad may result in death.

At the same time, according to the guideline of plastic bullets, they should be used with a certain distance and should not aim at peoples' head. However, the Hong Kong Police Force often use plastic bullets to headshot citizens, some even without prior warning. On 11-Aug-2019, a female demonstrator was headshot by plastic bullet and one of her eyeball is gone. On the same day, the Hong Kong Police Force also shoot plastic bullets from a very close distance.

The Hong Kong SAR government refused to form an independent investigation committee to investigate the current turmoil as well as the seemingly unlawful acts done by the Hong Kong police force.

In this regard, I would like to seek your assistance to instigate investigation into the unlawful enforcement of the Hong Kong Police, including the use of expired tear gas.

Thank you for your kind attention. I hope by your international impartial status as well as the connection with the UN, you can help us to stop the violence and offences being done by the HK Police, and bring true justice to us.
